concepts.name: Python Programming
concepts.description: A high-level, interpreted programming language known for its simplicity and readability. Python emphasizes code readability with its notable use of significant whitespace.

concepts.name: Variables
concepts.description: Named containers that store data values in programming. Variables can hold different types of data and can be reassigned.

concepts.name: Functions
concepts.description: Reusable blocks of code that perform specific tasks. Functions can accept parameters and return values.
examples: def add(a, b): return a + b

concepts.name: Object-Oriented Programming
concepts.description: A programming paradigm based on the concept of objects containing data and code. OOP focuses on encapsulation, inheritance, and polymorphism.
examples: class Person: def __init__(self, name): self.name = name

concepts.name: Classes
concepts.description: Blueprints for creating objects in object-oriented programming. Classes define attributes and methods that objects will have.
examples: class Rectangle: def __init__(self, width, height): self.width = width

concepts.name: Inheritance
concepts.description: A mechanism where a new class inherits properties and methods from an existing class. Enables code reuse and hierarchical relationships.

concepts.name: Polymorphism
concepts.description: The ability of different classes to be treated as instances of the same class through inheritance. Allows methods to do different things based on the object.

concepts.name: Encapsulation
concepts.description: The bundling of data and methods that operate on that data within a single unit. Restricts direct access to some components.
examples: getter methods: def get_name(self): return self._name
setter methods: def set_name(self, value): self._name = value

concepts.name: Abstraction
concepts.description: Hiding complex implementation details and showing only necessary features. Achieved through abstract classes and interfaces.
examples: Abstract base classes define interface contracts

concepts.name: Data Structures
concepts.description: Organized formats for storing and managing data efficiently. Includes lists, dictionaries, sets, and more complex structures.

concepts.name: Machine Learning
concepts.description: A subset of artificial intelligence that enables systems to learn and improve from experience without explicit programming.

concepts.name: Deep Learning
concepts.description: A subset of machine learning using neural networks with multiple layers. Particularly effective for image, speech, and natural language processing.
examples: Convolutional Neural Networks for image classification

concepts.name: Neural Networks
concepts.description: Computing systems inspired by biological neural networks. Consist of interconnected nodes organized in layers.
examples: Input layer, hidden layers, output layer

concepts.name: Linear Regression
concepts.description: A statistical method for modeling the relationship between a dependent variable and independent variables using a linear equation.

concepts.name: Data Cleaning
concepts.description: The process of detecting and correcting corrupt or inaccurate data. Essential preprocessing step in data science.

concepts.name: Feature Engineering
concepts.description: Creating new features from existing data to improve model performance. Critical skill in data science.

concepts.name: HTML
concepts.description: HyperText Markup Language - the standard markup language for creating web pages. Defines the structure and content of web documents.

concepts.name: CSS
concepts.description: Cascading Style Sheets - language for describing the presentation of HTML documents. Controls layout, colors, fonts, and visual appearance.

concepts.name: JavaScript
concepts.description: A high-level, interpreted programming language for web browsers. Enables interactive web pages and is essential for web development.
examples: Arrow functions: const add = (a, b) => a + b

concepts.name: React
concepts.description: A JavaScript library for building user interfaces, particularly single-page applications. Uses component-based architecture.

concepts.name: Vue.js
concepts.description: A progressive JavaScript framework for building user interfaces. Known for its simplicity and flexibility.

concepts.name: Angular
concepts.description: A TypeScript-based web application framework developed by Google. Provides comprehensive solution for building complex applications.

concepts.name: REST API
concepts.description: Representational State Transfer - architectural style for designing networked applications. Uses HTTP methods for CRUD operations.

concepts.name: GraphQL
concepts.description: A query language for APIs that provides a complete description of data. Allows clients to request exactly what they need.
examples: type User { id: ID! name: String! }

concepts.name: Docker
concepts.description: A platform for developing, shipping, and running applications in containers. Ensures consistency across environments.

concepts.name: Kubernetes
concepts.description: An open-source container orchestration platform for automating deployment, scaling, and management of containerized applications.

concepts.name: CI/CD
concepts.description: Continuous Integration and Continuous Deployment - practices that enable frequent code integration and automated deployment.
examples: Automated testing and deployment on git push

concepts.name: Jenkins
concepts.description: An open-source automation server for building, testing, and deploying software. Widely used for CI/CD pipelines.

concepts.name: Monitoring
concepts.description: The process of collecting, analyzing, and using information to track system performance and health.

concepts.name: Logging
concepts.description: Recording events, errors, and information about application execution. Essential for debugging and monitoring.

concepts.name: Git
concepts.description: A distributed version control system for tracking changes in source code. Essential tool for collaborative software development.

concepts.name: Testing
concepts.description: The process of evaluating software to find defects and verify it meets requirements. Includes unit, integration, and end-to-end tests.

concepts.name: Algorithms
concepts.description: Step-by-step procedures for solving problems or performing computations. Fundamental to computer science.

concepts.name: Databases
concepts.description: Organized collections of data stored and accessed electronically. Includes relational (SQL) and non-relational (NoSQL) databases.

concepts.name: APIs
concepts.description: Application Programming Interfaces - sets of protocols for building and integrating application software.

concepts.name: Microservices
concepts.description: Architectural style structuring applications as collections of loosely coupled services. Each service is independently deployable.
examples: User service, Order service, Payment service

concepts.name: Async Programming
concepts.description: Programming paradigm allowing concurrent execution of tasks without blocking. Essential for I/O-bound operations.
examples: async def fetch_data(): return await api.get('/data')

concepts.name: Type Hints
concepts.description: Optional static typing in Python for better code documentation and IDE support. Helps catch bugs early.
examples: def greet(name: str) -> str: return f'Hello, {name}'
from typing import List, Dict, Optional

concepts.name: Decorators
concepts.description: Functions that modify the behavior of other functions or classes. Powerful Python feature for code reuse.
examples: def decorator(func): def wrapper(*args): ...; return wrapper

concepts.name: List Comprehensions
concepts.description: Concise way to create lists in Python. More readable and often faster than traditional loops.
examples: [x for x in numbers if x % 2 == 0]
[(x, y) for x in range(3) for y in range(3)]

concepts.name: Context Managers
concepts.description: Python feature for resource management using 'with' statement. Ensures proper acquisition and release of resources.
examples: with open('file.txt') as f: data = f.read()

concepts.name: Generators
concepts.description: Functions that yield values one at a time instead of returning all at once. Memory-efficient for large datasets.
examples: def count_up(): n = 0; while True: yield n; n += 1

concepts.name: Exception Handling
concepts.description: Mechanism for handling runtime errors gracefully. Prevents program crashes and enables error recovery.

concepts.name: Recursion
concepts.description: A function calling itself to solve problems by breaking them into smaller subproblems. Elegant for certain algorithms.
examples: def factorial(n): return 1 if n <= 1 else n * factorial(n-1)

concepts.name: Design Patterns
concepts.description: Reusable solutions to common software design problems. Provide templates for solving recurring challenges.
examples: Factory: Create objects without specifying class
